title: Uptime Kuma LXC
textContent:
Uptime Kuma LXC 
                Uptime Kuma is a monitoring and alerting system that tracks the
                    availability and performance of servers, websites, and other internet-connected devices. It can be
                    self-hosted and is open-source, offering a visually appealing interface for monitoring and receiving
                    notifications about downtime events.
                To create a new Proxmox VE Uptime Kuma LXC, run the command below in the Proxmox VE Shell.
                    
                    To Update Uptime Kuma, run the command below (or type update) in the LXC Console.
                Copybash -c "$(wget -qLO - https://github.com/community-scripts/ProxmoxVE/raw/main/ct/uptimekuma.sh)"
                ⚡ Default Settings: 1GB RAM - 2GB Storage - 1vCPU ⚡
                Uptime Kuma Interface: IP:3001
outerHTML:
Uptime Kuma LXC

Uptime Kuma is a monitoring and alerting system that tracks the availability and performance of servers, websites, and other internet-connected devices. It can be self-hosted and is open-source, offering a visually appealing interface for monitoring and receiving notifications about downtime events.

To create a new Proxmox VE Uptime Kuma LXC, run the command below in the Proxmox VE Shell.
To Update Uptime Kuma, run the command below (or type update) in the LXC Console.

bash -c "$(wget -qLO - https://github.com/community-scripts/ProxmoxVE/raw/main/ct/uptimekuma.sh)"

⚡ Default Settings: 1GB RAM - 2GB Storage - 1vCPU ⚡

Uptime Kuma Interface: IP:3001
